name: Alterplaces
description:
Made in two weeks as part of My First Game Jam - Summer 2020.

More of a demo/proof of concept due to the time constraints of the jam, and the fact that it's the first thing I've ever made with Unity and every step was a learning process. I intend to expand it in the future, hopefully into a full (if still probably short) game.

If you have the interest, you can find the devlog here. It's somewhat incomplete as I was putting most of my energy into development, but I hope to write up a postmortem to add to it after taking a breath or two post-jam. I learned a lot and am really glad to have participated. Big thanks to the community and everyone in the MFGJ discord!

Controls:

  • Arrow keys to move
  • Space to jump
  • Left shift to swap to dark world
  • Z to swap to light world
  • Left shift + Z to swap to void world
  • P to pause

Controllers may also work, but all won't be supported. As tested with an Xbox One controller:

  • LS to move
  • A to jump
  • Left and right bumper to swap worlds
  • Menu/Start to pause

As it is right now it's fairly easy to get yourself into walls when swapping between worlds, but you can always swap to the void world to fall offscreen and trigger a respawn.

Thanks for playing!

Design, programming, art, and music by Justin Crandall

TripFive font by PixelMush

Massive thanks to the YouTube channels of Bardent, Brackeys, and Lost Relic Games
